name: The Ravine of the Stag Lord
tagline: Ferns grown to extraordinary heights, towering above the heads of explorers.
description: Deep in the trackless woods of the east of this hex, deer paths lead to a secluded ravine. A winding series of ledges creates a route to the bottom, where the folded strata of the rock form a natural amphitheatre.

points_of_interest.name: Ravine of the Stag Lord
points_of_interest.description: Deep in the trackless woods of the east of this hex, deer paths lead to a secluded ravine. A winding series of ledges creates a route to the bottom, where the folded strata of the rock form a natural amphitheatre.
points_of_interest.interior: The amphitheatre faces a large grotto lined with sparkling mineral formations. Much of the grotto's floor is occupied by a wide and shallow pool. Detection of magic shows both the pool and the grotto enveloped in a spiritual aura. A multitude of hoof prints can be seen in the mud around the pool. Most of the prints are those of large stags, but the occasional giant, web-toed humanoid footprint can also be spotted.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: On black nights of the new moon, 3d6 stags (red deer) trace the winding forest ways and make their way to the chasm floor. There is a 2-in-6 chance they are accompanied by 1d4 deorlings. The gigantic, headless Stag Lord manifests, emerging from the waters of the shallow pool in the grotto.
special_features: Those who touch the pool experience an icy chill and must Save Versus Hold or the touching limb is paralysed for 1d3 days
On new moon nights, stags gather and bellow in unison to summon the Stag Lord
During the procession, the stags' antlers emanate an ultraviolet glow. Severed antlers function as a Arcane Longsword for one day before losing their power
Interrupting the Stag Lord during cavorting requires a Reaction Roll - if positive, the Stag Lord halts to converse; otherwise, stags attack for 1d4 Rounds

points_of_interest.name: The Willow Gate
points_of_interest.description: A natural archway formed of intertwined willow branches, swaying gently in a cool otherworldly breeze, can be found in an isolated part of this hex.
points_of_interest.entering: Stepping through the archway, one is whisked away to the fairy road Skipping-a-Derry

npcs.name: Yorghan—The Stag Lord
npcs.title: Wood God
npcs.description: A 30′ tall, lumbering humanoid with toad-like skin and hands and great fronds of shaggy fur hanging between its arms and torso. Its head is missing, causing the Wood God to stagger and lurch.
demeanor: out of touch with the modern world
npcs.speech: Gentle booming. Can communicate with all sentient beings through psychic projection.
languages: Psychic projection to all sentient beings
desires: To maintain the wilds of Dolmenwood and the dominion of the stags
To retrieve its head from the clutches of Atanuwë (hex 0904)
npcs.stat_reference: Large Monstrosity—Sentient—Neutral, Level 20 AC 16 HP 102 Saves D2 R2 H2 B3 S4, Att 2 stamps / fists (+13, 2d6 + evaporation) Speed 50 Morale 10 XP 4,050

secrets: The retinue of stags would enthusiastically join any who proposed a mission to retrieve the head

Any who return the Stag Lord's head are blessed with a set of magic antlers upon their crown—treat as an Arcane Longsword—and granted the undying friendship of all stags in Dolmenwood, as well as the ability to speak their secret language
dm_notes: Ley line Ywyr: Arcane spell-casters perceive the distant moaning of the dead.
